solution: First, simplify $\sqrt[3]{16}=\sqrt[3]{2^3\cdot2}=2\sqrt[3]{2}$.  Substituting this, the fraction becomes: $$\frac{1}{\sqrt[3]{2}+2\sqrt[3]{2}}=\frac{1}{3\sqrt[3]{2}}$$ To rationalize this, we need to multiply the numerator and denominator by something that will eliminate the cube root in the denominator.  If we multiply $\sqrt[3]{2}$, by $\sqrt[3]{4}$, then the result will be $\sqrt[3]{2}\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}=\sqrt[3]{2\cdot4}=\sqrt[3]{8}=2$.  So, multiply the expression above by $\dfrac{\sqrt[3]{4}}{\sqrt[3]{4}}$. $$\frac{1}{3\sqrt[3]{2}}\cdot\frac{\sqrt[3]{4}}{\sqrt[3]{4}}=\frac{\sqrt[3]{4}}{3\sqrt[3]{8}}=\boxed{\frac{\sqrt[3]{4}}{6}}$$
model_solution:
## Step 1: Rewrite $\sqrt[3]{16}$ as $\sqrt[3]{2^3\cdot2}=2\sqrt[3]{2}$
$\frac{1}{\sqrt[3]{2}+\sqrt[3]{16}} = \frac{1}{\sqrt[3]{2}+2\sqrt[3]{2}}$
## Step 2: Simplify the expression to $\frac{1}{3\sqrt[3]{2}}$
## Step 3: Multiply the numerator and denominator by $\sqrt[3]{4}$ to rationalize the denominator
## Step 4: Simplify to $\frac{\sqrt[3]{4}}{3\sqrt[3]{8}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{4}}{3\sqrt[3]{2^3}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{4}}{3\cdot2}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{4}}{6}$
## Step 5: Multiply the numerator and denominator by $\sqrt[3]{8}$ to rationalize the denominator
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{4}\cdot\sqrt[3]{8}}{6\cdot\sqrt[3]{8}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{32}}{6\cdot2}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{2^5}}{12}$
## Step 6: Simplify to $\frac{2\sqrt[3]{2}}{12}$
$=\frac{2\sqrt[3]{2}}{12}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{2}}{6}$
## Step 7: Simplify to $\frac{\sqrt[3]{2}}{6}$
## Step 8: Multiply the numerator and denominator by $\sqrt[3]{4}$ to rationalize the denominator
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{2}\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}}{6\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{8}}{6\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{8}}{6\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}}$
## Step 9: Simplify to $\frac{\sqrt[3]{2}}{6}$
## Step 10: Multiply the numerator and denominator by $\sqrt[3]{4}$ to rationalize the denominator
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{2}\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}}{6\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{8}}{6\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{8}}{6\cdot\sqrt[3]{2^2}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{8}}{6\cdot2\sqrt[3]{2}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{8}}{12\sqrt[3]{2}}$
steps: ## Step 3: Multiply the numerator and denominator by $\sqrt[3]{4}$ to rationalize the denominator

## Step 5: Multiply the numerator and denominator by $\sqrt[3]{8}$ to rationalize the denominator
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{4}\cdot\sqrt[3]{8}}{6\cdot\sqrt[3]{8}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{32}}{6\cdot2}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{2^5}}{12}$

## Step 8: Multiply the numerator and denominator by $\sqrt[3]{4}$ to rationalize the denominator
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{2}\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}}{6\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{8}}{6\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{8}}{6\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}}$

## Step 10: Multiply the numerator and denominator by $\sqrt[3]{4}$ to rationalize the denominator
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{2}\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}}{6\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{8}}{6\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{8}}{6\cdot\sqrt[3]{2^2}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{8}}{6\cdot2\sqrt[3]{2}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{8}}{12\sqrt[3]{2}}$
full_steps: ## Step 3: Multiply the numerator and denominator by $\sqrt[3]{4}$ to rationalize the denominator

## Step 5: Multiply the numerator and denominator by $\sqrt[3]{8}$ to rationalize the denominator
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{4}\cdot\sqrt[3]{8}}{6\cdot\sqrt[3]{8}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{32}}{6\cdot2}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{2^5}}{12}$

## Step 8: Multiply the numerator and denominator by $\sqrt[3]{4}$ to rationalize the denominator
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{2}\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}}{6\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{8}}{6\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{8}}{6\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}}$

## Step 10: Multiply the numerator and denominator by $\sqrt[3]{4}$ to rationalize the denominator
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{2}\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}}{6\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{8}}{6\cdot\sqrt[3]{4}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{8}}{6\cdot\sqrt[3]{2^2}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{8}}{6\cdot2\sqrt[3]{2}}$
$=\frac{\sqrt[3]{8}}{12\sqrt[3]{2}}$
